# investor-agent: Quick Action Checklist

## IMMEDIATE (Next 7 Days)

### Day 1 - Strategic Planning
- [ ] Review full content marketing analysis
- [ ] Identify budget/resources available
- [ ] Decide on team structure (solo vs. distributed)
- [ ] Determine primary KPIs to track
- [ ] Set up analytics tracking (Google Analytics for docs site)

### Day 2-3 - README Enhancement
- [ ] Add "Why This Matters" narrative section (50 words)
- [ ] Restructure Quick Start into 3 tiers:
  - "Just Want to Try It?"
  - "Building an AI Agent?"
  - "Advanced Setup?"
- [ ] Add 4-5 concrete use case examples
- [ ] Create feature comparison table vs alternatives
- [ ] Add ASCII architecture diagram
- [ ] Update badges section for social proof
- [ ] Add troubleshooting section
- [ ] Test README rendering on GitHub

### Day 4 - GitHub Infrastructure
- [ ] Enable GitHub Discussions
- [ ] Create CONTRIBUTING.md
- [ ] Create CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
- [ ] Create ROADMAP.md (3-6 month vision)
- [ ] Create examples/gallery directory
- [ ] Update repository description/keywords for SEO
- [ ] Add GitHub topics: mcp, finance, trading, agent, llm

### Day 5 - Social Launch
- [ ] Create Twitter/X account: @investoragentmcp
- [ ] Create profile with compelling bio
- [ ] Write 10 inaugural tweets (schedule in Buffer)
- [ ] Follow 50-100 relevant accounts
- [ ] Create LinkedIn company page (optional)

### Day 6-7 - Content Kickoff
- [ ] Outline first blog post: "MCP for Finance: Why AI Agents Need Market Data"
- [ ] Start documentation site skeleton (GitHub Pages)
- [ ] Set up basic docs structure (Getting Started, API Reference)
- [ ] Create content calendar spreadsheet for 6 months

---

## WEEK 2-4 (Documentation & Initial Content)

### Documentation Site (8-10 hours)
- [ ] Set up GitHub Pages with Jekyll or use Markdown-based template
- [ ] Create page structure:
  - [ ] Getting Started guide (copy from README, expand)
  - [ ] Core Concepts (What is MCP? Why finance tools?)
  - [ ] API Reference (1 page per tool, auto-generate from docstrings)
  - [ ] Troubleshooting guide
  - [ ] FAQ section
- [ ] Add navigation menu
- [ ] Add search functionality (optional: Algolia)
- [ ] Set up custom domain if budget allows
- [ ] Optimize for SEO (meta descriptions, headings)

### Blog Content (12-16 hours)
- [ ] Publish Blog Post #1: "MCP for Finance" (1,500 words)
  - Post on: Dev.to + GitHub Discussions + own site
  - Write social snippet version
  - Create quote graphics for Twitter
- [ ] Publish Blog Post #2: "Building Financial AI Agents" (2,000 words)
  - Post on: Dev.to + GitHub Discussions
  - Create 8-tweet thread for Twitter
  - Email to newsletter (if newsletter exists)
- [ ] Start outline for Blog Post #3-5

### Community Setup (4-6 hours)
- [ ] Create GitHub Discussions categories:
  - Announcements
  - Q&A / Help
  - Show & Tell
  - Ideas & Feature Requests
- [ ] Write welcome post in Discussions
- [ ] Post first blog article as discussion thread
- [ ] Create "Monthly Highlights" template
- [ ] Respond to any existing issues/discussions

### Social Media Execution (6-8 hours)
- [ ] Tweet schedule: 3-4 posts per week
- [ ] Create Twitter content templates:
  - Educational tweet (explain concept)
  - Feature highlight (new capability)
  - Community celebration (user project)
  - Industry insight (market news)
- [ ] Schedule first 2 weeks of tweets
- [ ] Set up social listening for mentions
- [ ] Engage with 10-20 relevant accounts daily

## MONTH 2-3 (Scaling Content & Community)

### Blog Expansion
- [ ] Publish 4-5 additional blog posts:
  - [ ] Tutorials (2-3 posts with code examples)
  - [ ] Comparison/migration content (1 post)
  - [ ] Advanced deep-dives (1-2 posts)
- [ ] Create social snippets for each post (3 variations)
- [ ] Guest post pitch: 1-2 target publications
- [ ] Improve SEO: Internal linking, keywords optimization
- [ ] Track engagement metrics per post

### Video Content
- [ ] Create 3-5 video scripts (2-10 minutes each):
  - [ ] Getting Started (3 min)
  - [ ] Building an Agent (8 min)
  - [ ] Sentiment Analysis (6 min)
  - [ ] Advanced features (7 min)
  - [ ] Troubleshooting (5 min)
- [ ] Film videos (or use screen recording)
- [ ] Edit and optimize for YouTube
- [ ] Create YouTube channel and thumbnails
- [ ] Publish videos with detailed descriptions and links

### Community Growth
- [ ] Identify 10-15 community projects using investor-agent
- [ ] Reach out: "Love your project! Can we feature it?"
- [ ] Interview approach: Offer to document their work
- [ ] Create 2-3 case studies (1,200-1,500 words each)
- [ ] Feature projects in README/Awesome list
- [ ] Monthly community highlights email

### Newsletter (If Launching)
- [ ] Set up Substack or Beehiiv account
- [ ] Write welcome email + onboarding sequence
- [ ] Create content calendar (4 emails/month)
- [ ] Add newsletter signup to:
  - Blog sidebar
  - GitHub README
  - Twitter bio
  - Documentation site
- [ ] Target: 200-500 subscribers by month 3

## DELEGATION OPTIONS (For Distributed Team)

### If Adding Content Marketer (10 hrs/week)
- [ ] Own: All blog content, social media strategy
- [ ] Own: Newsletter management
- [ ] Own: Community email communications
- [ ] Support: Video script development
- [ ] Delegate to Creator: Technical accuracy review, final approval

### If Adding Community Manager (8 hrs/week)
- [ ] Own: GitHub Discussions moderation
- [ ] Own: Community event planning/hosting
- [ ] Own: Contributor recognition program
- [ ] Own: First-line support for user questions
- [ ] Support: Blog content promotion
- [ ] Escalate technical issues to Creator

### If Adding Technical Writer (6 hrs/week)
- [ ] Own: Documentation site maintenance
- [ ] Own: API reference updates
- [ ] Own: Tutorial/guide documentation
- [ ] Own: Troubleshooting guide expansion
- [ ] Support: Blog content technical review
- [ ] Delegate to Creator: Architecture docs, design patterns

## SUCCESS MILESTONES (Checkpoints)

### Week 4 Milestone
- [ ] README enhanced + 25% better engagement
- [ ] GitHub Discussions active with 5+ discussions
- [ ] First 2 blog posts published (2,000+ readers each)
- [ ] Twitter account to 100 followers
- [ ] Documentation site live (basic)

### Month 2 Milestone
- [ ] 4-5 blog posts published (5,000+ monthly traffic)
- [ ] Newsletter: 50-100 subscribers
- [ ] Twitter: 300+ followers
- [ ] Community: 1-2 featured projects
- [ ] GitHub Discussions: 20+ threads

### Month 3 Milestone
- [ ] 8-10 blog posts published (15,000+ monthly traffic)
- [ ] Newsletter: 300-400 subscribers
- [ ] Twitter: 400+ followers, 1,000+ combined reach per tweet
- [ ] YouTube: 1-2 videos published, 100+ views each
- [ ] Community: 3-5 featured projects, 50+ discussion threads
- [ ] GitHub stars: +100-150 from baseline

### Month 6 Milestone
- [ ] 15+ blog posts (40,000-60,000 monthly traffic)
- [ ] Newsletter: 1,000+ subscribers
- [ ] Twitter: 500-800 followers
- [ ] YouTube: 5 videos, 100-500 views each
- [ ] Community: 200-300 members, 10-15 featured projects
- [ ] GitHub stars: 400-600 total (+300-500 from start)
- [ ] PyPI downloads: +40-50% growth

## Budget Breakdown (Optional)

### Minimal Budget ($0/month)
- Use free tools: GitHub Pages, Twitter, Dev.to, YouTube
- Time investment: 10-15 hours/week

### Moderate Budget ($50-100/month)
- Add: Substack newsletter ($0-12)
- Add: Buffer social scheduling ($15)
- Add: Midjourney images ($20)
- Add: Canva Pro ($15)
- Add: Domain + email ($12)
- Time investment: 10-15 hours/week

### Healthy Budget ($200-300/month)
- Content creator/marketer: $2,000-3,000/month part-time
- All tools above + upgrades
- Paid content distribution (optional)

---

## Risk Mitigation Checklist

### Burnout Prevention
- [ ] Set clear working hours for community engagement
- [ ] Don't aim for instant responses to every comment
- [ ] Batch content creation (dedicate specific days)
- [ ] Plan for time off/breaks
- [ ] Delegate early (don't wait until overwhelmed)

### Quality Control
- [ ] Have someone review blog posts before publishing
- [ ] Spell-check and edit all content
- [ ] Test code examples before publishing
- [ ] Validate claims with data/sources
- [ ] Track corrections/updates needed

### Community Health
- [ ] Enforce CODE_OF_CONDUCT consistently
- [ ] Address negative behavior early
- [ ] Celebrate positive contributions visibly
- [ ] Create psychological safety for questions
- [ ] Welcome disagreement and feedback

### Content Sustainability
- [ ] Don't overcommit on publishing cadence
- [ ] Create content library for repurposing
- [ ] Plan for lower-effort content weeks
- [ ] Use templates to speed up creation
- [ ] Measure ROI - stop low-performing activities

---

## Resources & Templates

### Blog Post Template
```markdown
# [Title]

## Hook (2-3 sentences)
[Compelling opening that establishes relevance]

## Problem Statement (1 paragraph)
[What problem does this solve?]

## Context/Background (1-2 paragraphs)
[Why does this matter now?]

## Solution (2-4 sections with code examples)
[How investor-agent solves this]

## Key Takeaways (3-5 bullet points)
[Quick recap of main points]

## Next Steps
[Links to documentation, code, further reading]

## Call to Action
[Encourage GitHub star, newsletter signup, Twitter follow]
```

### Twitter Thread Template
```
Tweet 1: Hook (make reader want to read next 5-7 tweets)
Tweet 2: Introduce topic/problem
Tweet 3-5: Main content (facts, data, insights)
Tweet 6: Key takeaway
Tweet 7: CTA (link to full blog, code example, etc.)
```

## Accountability Check (Weekly)

**Each week ask yourself:**
- [ ] Did I publish something this week? (Blog, tweet, video, update)
- [ ] Did I engage with community? (Respond to issues/discussions)
- [ ] Did I measure impact? (Check analytics, feedback)
- [ ] Did I stay within time budget? (Didn't overwork)
- [ ] Am I on track for monthly milestones? (Check against goals)
